H0.text: In what European city was snooker player John Higgins stung by the News of the World newspaper relating to an alleged betting fix. Warsaw

H1.text: In what European city was snooker player John Higgins stung by the News of the World newspaper relating to an alleged betting fix. Budapest

H2.text: In what European city was snooker player John Higgins stung by the News of the World newspaper relating to an alleged betting fix. Prague

H3.text: In what European city was snooker player John Higgins stung by the News of the World newspaper relating to an alleged betting fix. Kiev

A4.text: On 30  April, an undercover News of the World team, led by Mazher Mahmood, posing as promoters, had met Higgins and his manager in a hotel room in Kyiv under the pretence of organising a series of events linked to the World Series of Snooker.

A5.text: In 2010, a tabloid newspaper carried out a sting operation in Ukraine, in which it claimed to show Higgins and his then-manager arranging to lose specific frames in future matches for money.
